revisions.rev:
{{Infobox tvseason | image = | season_name = Casualty'' Series 15 | show_name = ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' | bgcolour = #001166 | fgcolour = #ffffff | dvd_release_date = Unknown | country = [[United Kingdom]] | network = [[BBC]] | first_aired = {{Start date|2000|9|16|df=y}} | last_aired = {{End date|2001|4|28|df=y}} | num_episodes = 36 | prev_series = [[Casualty (series 14)|14]] | next_series = [[Casualty (series 16)|16]] }} The fifteenth series of the [[United Kingdom|British]] [[medical drama]] [[television series]] ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' commenced airing in the United Kingdom on BBC One on 16 September 2000 and finished on 28 April 2001. [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0096555/episodes#season-15 IMDB Casualty Series 15] It saw another increase, this time to 36 episodes, including two hour-long self-contained 'specials', Sympathy for the Devil (episode 8) and Something from the Heart (episode 23), which were shown in addition to the regular Saturday night episodes.


==Cast== *[[Derek Thompson (actor)|Derek Thompson]] as Charlie Fairhead *[[Robert Gwilym]] as Max Gallagher *[[Ian Kelsey]] as Patrick Spiller *[[Sandra Huggett]] as Holly Miles *[[Ian Bleasdale]] as Josh Griffiths *[[Donna Alexander]] as Penny Hutchens *[[Pal Aron]] as Adam Osman (Episodes 1-6) *[[Cathy Shipton]] as Lisa "Duffy" Duffin *[[Philip Bretherton]] as Andrew Bower (Episodes 12-36) *[[Jan Anderson (actress)|Jan Anderson]] as Chloe Hill *[[Kwame Kwei-Armah]] as Finlay "Fin" Newton *[[Michelle Butterly]] as Melanie "Mel" Dyson *[[Ben Keaton]] as Spencer *[[Ronnie McCann]] as Barney Woolfe *[[Rebecca Wheatley]] as Amy Howard (Episodes 1-29) *[[Kieron Forsyth]] as Tom Harvey (Episodes 13-30, 35-36) *[[Grant Masters]] as Dan Robinson *[[Adjoh Andoa]] as Colette Kierney *[[Zita Sattar]] as Anna Paul (Episode 28 onwards) *[[Will Mellor]] as Jack Vincent (Episode 31 onwards) *[[Morag Siller]] as Leona (Various) *[[Sam Barriscale]] as Reuben Hurst (Episodes 1-6) ==Episodes== {{Main|List of Casualty episodes}} {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! style="background:#001166;"| Episode #"Episode #" refers to the episode's number in the overall series, whereas "Series #" refers to the episode's number in this particular series. ! style="background:#001166;"| Series # ! style="background:#001166;"| Episode ! style="background:#001166;"| Director ! style="background:#001166;"| Writer(s) ! style="background:#001166"| Original airdate ! style="background:#001166;"| Viewers (millions) {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=285 |EpisodeNumber2=1 |Title=Phoenix |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Ben Cooper |DirectedBy=Tim Leandro |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|9|16|df=y}} |Aux4=9.86 |ShortSummary= Charlie (Derek Thompson), recovering from his pulmonary embolism meets a young mother and her baby, Phoenix. When the mother tries to commit suicide, Charlie springs into action, doing just what he knows best. Return of Spencer (Ben Keaton) and arrival of Senior Staff Nurse Colette Kierney (Adjoh Andoa) |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=286 |EpisodeNumber2=2 |Title=Accidents Happen |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Jeff Povey |DirectedBy=Dominic Lees |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|9|23|df=y}} |Aux4=9.24 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=287 |EpisodeNumber2=3 |Title=Getting to Know You |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Simon Moss |DirectedBy=Ged Maguire |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|9|30|df=y}} |Aux4=9.48 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=288 |EpisodeNumber2=4 |Title=Too Tight to Mention |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Suzie Smith |DirectedBy=Gill Wilkinson |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|10|7|df=y}} |Aux4=9.89 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=289 |EpisodeNumber2=5 |Title=Choked (Part 1 of 2) |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Katharine Way |DirectedBy=Robert Del Maestro |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|10|14|df=y}} |Aux4=9.97 |ShortSummary= The press have found out about Adam - He's HIV positive. Can the staff convince the public there's nothing to fear, or is it curtains for Adam's career as an A&E Nurse? |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=290 |EpisodeNumber2=6 |Title=Choked (Part 2 of 2) |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Katharine Way |DirectedBy=Robert Del Maestro |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|10|15|df=y}} |Aux4=9.30 |ShortSummary= Josh has been caught in a mudslide and Adam decides to make a statement to the press. Deciding to quit, Adam and Reuben get married and drive off to the sound of salsa. Meanwhile, Leona (Morag Siller) is back in the department. Final appearances of Staff Nurse Adam Osman (Pal Aron) and Reuben Hurst (Sam Barriscale) |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=291 |EpisodeNumber2=7 |Title=Travelling Light |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Matthew Leys |DirectedBy=Michael Owen Morris |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|10|21|df=y}} |Aux4=9.01 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=292 |EpisodeNumber2=8 |Title=Sympathy for the Devil |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Len Collin |DirectedBy=Michael Owen Morris |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|10|22|df=y}} |Aux4=7.40 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=293 |EpisodeNumber2=9 |Title=No More Mr. Nice Guy |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Chris Jury |DirectedBy=Adrian Bean |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|10|28|df=y}} |Aux4=8.77 |ShortSummary= Patrick (Ian Kelsey) spends a day with paramedics Josh (Ian Bleasdale) and Fin (Kwame Kwei-Armah). Deliberately winding them up, Patrick is not the most popular of passengers |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=294 |EpisodeNumber2=10 |Title=States of Shock |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Susan Boyd |DirectedBy=Albert Barber |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|11|4|df=y}} |Aux4=8.35 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=295 |EpisodeNumber2=11 |Title=Marking Time |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Len Collin |DirectedBy=Patrick Tucker |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|11|11|df=y}} |Aux4=8.91 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=296 |EpisodeNumber2=12 |Title=Starting Over |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Kathrine Smith |DirectedBy=Graham Moore |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|11|18|df=y}} |Aux4=8.92 |ShortSummary= Andrew Bower (Philip Bretherton), Duffy's husband has returned to the department following Broadway General's closure. Can Duffy (Cathy Shipton) pull herself together and be able to work amicably with Andrew or are the couple heading for a fall? |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=297 |EpisodeNumber2=13 |Title=If You Go Down to the Wards Today |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Jeff Povey |DirectedBy=Kate Cheeseman |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|11|25|df=y}} |Aux4=8.91 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=298 |EpisodeNumber2=14 |Title=Coming Clean |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Patrick Melanaphy |DirectedBy=Julie Edwards |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|12|2|df=y}} |Aux4=8.21 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=299 |EpisodeNumber2=15 |Title=Chinese Whispers |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Clive Dawson |DirectedBy=Alan Wareing |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|12|9|df=y}} |Aux4=9.41 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=300 |EpisodeNumber2=16 |Title=A Turn of the Scrooge |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Simon Moss |DirectedBy=Simon Meyers |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|12|16|df=y}} |Aux4=9.90 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=301 |EpisodeNumber2=17 |Title=Merry Christmas Dr. Spiller |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Jeff Povey |DirectedBy=Michael Owen Morris |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|12|23|df=y}} |Aux4=9.77 |ShortSummary= Holly (Sandra Huggett) has taken Patrick (Ian Kelsey) to a christmas meal but is met with snide remarks and sarcasm from the ever moody registrar. On the way back to the department for their shifts, Patrick's car breaks down in the snow and the two medics are forced to seek shelter in a disused barn where more than a few secrets are going to be told. |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=302 |EpisodeNumber2=18 |Title=Epiphany |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Suzie Smith |DirectedBy=Dominic Lees |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2000|12|30|df=y}} |Aux4=10.40 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=303 |EpisodeNumber2=19 |Title=On the Edge |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Carolyn Sally Jones |DirectedBy=Kate Cheeseman |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|1|6|df=y}} |Aux4=9.63 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=304 |EpisodeNumber2=20 |Title=Girl Power |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Matthew Leys |DirectedBy=N.G. Bristow |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|1|13|df=y}} |Aux4=10.02 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=305 |EpisodeNumber2=21 |Title=Heart of Gold |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Ben Cooper |DirectedBy=Albert Barber |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|1|20|df=y}} |Aux4=9.09 |ShortSummary= Patrick (Ian Kelsey) and Spencer (Ben Keaton) are taken hostage by an ex-navy officer who doesn't want his daughter to see one of Spencer's old shipmates. Will Holly (Sandra Huggett) be able to figure out Patrick's coded message and save them before it's too late? |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=306 |EpisodeNumber2=22 |Title=Better Safe Than Sorry |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Chris Jury |DirectedBy=Tim Holloway |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|1|27|df=y}} |Aux4=9.13 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=307 |EpisodeNumber2=23 |Title=Something from the Heart |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Graham Mitchell |DirectedBy=Paul Duane |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|2|2|df=y}} |Aux4=7.82 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=308 |EpisodeNumber2=24 |Title=Big Mistake |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Patrick Melanaphy |DirectedBy=Brett Fallis |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|2|3|df=y}} |Aux4=9.14 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=309 |EpisodeNumber2=25 |Title=Ambulance Chaser |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Len Collin |DirectedBy=Ged Maguire |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|2|10|df=y}} |Aux4=9.37 |ShortSummary= Josh (Ian Bleasdale), Fin (Kwame Kwei-Armah), Barney (Ronnie McCann) and Tom (Kieron Forsyth) have only one thing in mind - they must transfer a critical burns patient to another hospital before he dies of his injuries. Little do they expect a teenager to try to flag them down on their way... |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=310 |EpisodeNumber2=26 |Title=Scent of the Roses |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Susan Boyd |DirectedBy=Julie Edwards |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|2|17|df=y}} |Aux4=9.03 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=311 |EpisodeNumber2=27 |Title=Breaking Point |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Isabelle Grey |DirectedBy=Tim Leandro |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|2|24|df=y}} |Aux4=8.92 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=312 |EpisodeNumber2=28 |Title=Lost and Found |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Simon Moss |DirectedBy=Nic Phillips |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|3|3|df=y}} |Aux4=9.25 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=313 |EpisodeNumber2=29 |Title=Kindness of Strangers |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Suzie Smith |DirectedBy=N.G. Bristow |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|3|10|df=y}} |Aux4=9.52 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=314 |EpisodeNumber2=30 |Title=Only You |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Chris Ould |DirectedBy=Graham Moore |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|3|17|df=y}} |Aux4=9.39 |ShortSummary= Tom (Kieron Forsyth) has finally achieved his goal. He's got Holly (Sandra Huggett) alone with him in his house. Can Dan (Grant Masters) figure out the truth behind Holly's mysterious stalker and save her before it's too late? |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=315 |EpisodeNumber2=31 |Title=Allied Forces |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Kathrine Smith |DirectedBy=Patrick Tucker |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|3|24|df=y}} |Aux4=8.82 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=316 |EpisodeNumber2=32 |Title=Heroes and Villains |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Carolyn Sally Jones |DirectedBy=Paul Duane |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|3|31|df=y}} |Aux4=8.38 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=317 |EpisodeNumber2=33 |Title=The Long Road Home |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Jeff Povey |DirectedBy=Alan Wareing |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|4|7|df=y}} |Aux4=8.85 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=318 |EpisodeNumber2=34 |Title=Mix and Match |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Chris Webb |DirectedBy=Paul Murton |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|4|14|df=y}} |Aux4=8.64 |ShortSummary= |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=319 |EpisodeNumber2=35 |Title=Breaking the Spell (Part 1 of 2) |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Katharine Way |DirectedBy=Tim Leandro |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|4|21|df=y}} |Aux4=8.24 |ShortSummary= Tom (Kieron Forsyth) has been released on conditional bail and makes a beeline for A&E. When Holly (Sandra Huggett) hears her car alarm going off, she goes outside to investigate - discovering that the glass has been smashed and Tom is right behind her... |LineColor=001166 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Casualty episodes |EpisodeNumber=320 |EpisodeNumber2=36 |Title=Breaking the Spell (Part 2 of 2) |RTitle= |WrittenBy=Katharine Way |DirectedBy=Tim Leandro |OriginalAirDate={{Start date|2001|4|28|df=y}} |Aux4=9.95 |ShortSummary= Tom (Kieron Forsyth) has kidnapped Holly (Sandra Huggett) and is holding her in a disused area of the hospital. Elsewhere Patrick (Ian Kelsey), Dan (Grant Masters) and Spencer (Ben Keaton) work together to save Holly but Andrew (Philip Bretherton) proves to be the biggest casualty of the night...Final appearances of Anaesthetist Tom Harvey, Locum Consultant Andrew Bower, Staff Nurse Barney Woolfe (Ronnie McCann), Paramedics Penny Hutchens (Donna Alexander) and Melanie Dyson (Michelle Butterly), Directorate Manager Dan Robinson and SHO Holly Miles. |LineColor=001166 }} |} ==Notes== ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0096555/episodes#season-15 Casualty series 15] at the [[Internet Movie Database]] * [http://www.tv.com/casualty/show/1507/episode.html?tag=ep_guide;paginator;15&season=15 Casualty series 15] at [[TV.com]] {{Holby|Casualty}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Casualty (Series 15)}} [[Category:Lists of drama television series episodes|Casualty 15]] [[Category:Lists of British television series episodes|Casualty 15]] [[Category:Casualty series| ]] [[Category:2000 television seasons]] [[Category:2001 television seasons]]
